intro: Eriocephalus microphyllus, commonly known as the silverleaf dandelion, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its small, silver-gray leaves and bright yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in grasslands and rocky areas. Its unique foliage and ornamental flowers make it a popular choice for gardens and conservation efforts.
